channel.title: Comments on: Implementing WCAT to Load Test a Website
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: JeremySavoy
item.dc:creator: JeremySavoy
item.description: Hi Eli. Great article - thanks! I am just getting started with using WCAT and I seem to be having some issues with cookies. All the documentation seems to suggest these are handled for us without having to do anything special but when I do a GET on a URL that sets a cookie (I can see it doing that through Fiddler) it doesn't seem to get remembered by the WCAT virtual client for the next steps in the Transaction. Can you think of any reason why or anything I should be doing to make that work? Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
Hi Eli. Great article – thanks!
I am just getting started with using WCAT and I seem to be having some issues with cookies. All the documentation seems to suggest these are handled for us without having to do anything special but when I do a GET on a URL that sets a cookie (I can see it doing that through Fiddler) it doesn’t seem to get remembered by the WCAT virtual client for the next steps in the Transaction. Can you think of any reason why or anything I should be doing to make that work?
Thanks!

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: I haven't used it for HTTPS, but it is possible (and, oddly enough, is something I might be doing later today). From a brief look, it may be necessary o configure the protocol (TLS vs SSL3, etc) in order for it to work right, I'm not sure if it will detect that automatically.
item.content:encoded: I haven’t used it for HTTPS, but it is possible (and, oddly enough, is something I might be doing later today). From a brief look, it may be necessary o configure the protocol (TLS vs SSL3, etc) in order for it to work right, I’m not sure if it will detect that automatically.

item.title: By: danarts
item.dc:creator: danarts
item.description: hi eli, thanks for this nice articles, it help me a lot. i have on doubt, is it possible to test https website in wcat
item.content:encoded:
hi eli,
thanks for this nice articles, it help me a lot. i have on doubt, is it possible to test https website in wcat

item.title: By: ct
item.dc:creator: ct
item.description:
Hi eli,
im new to this wcat. i just run this command wcat.wsf –terminate –update –clients localhost but then i got error "the handle is invalid". Could you help me what is the issue about?
item.content:encoded:
Hi eli,

im new to this wcat. i just run this command wcat.wsf –terminate –update –clients localhost but then i got error “the handle is invalid”. Could you help me what is the issue about?

item.title: By: Heucles Junior
item.dc:creator: Heucles Junior
item.content:encoded:
Hey Eli, first of all I´v like to say, that your article helped me a lot, however I have some doubts about it when it comes to an dual machine environment, what I wasn´t able to understand is if I have to install the controller in the server where my website is hosted or in the client machine, how can I do it? And what about the server, do I have to install it, how can I do that?

Now I have my app, and wcat in the same machine, I´ve followed your instructions and it worked so far,

Thank you in advance.

Heucles
